text.value: Explain what @core\resources\views\templates\basic\partials\footer.blade.php:9-121 ( @core\resources\views\templates\basic\partials\footer.blade.php ) does in simple terms. Assume the audience is a beginner programmer who has just learned the language features and basic syntax. Focus on explaining: 1) The purpose of the code 2) What input(s) it takes 3) What output(s) it produces 4) How it achieves its purpose through the logic and algorithm. 5) Any important logic flows or data transformations happening. Use simple language a beginner could understand. Include enough detail to give a full picture of what the code aims to accomplish without getting too technical. Format the explanation in coherent paragraphs, using proper punctuation and grammar. Write the explanation assuming no prior context about the code is known. Do not make assumptions about variables or functions not shown in the shared code. Start the answer with the name of the code that is being explained.

The code in core\resources\views\templates\basic\partials\footer.blade.php is a template for generating the footer section of a website. Here's an explanation of what it does:
This code creates the structure and content for the footer of a website. It's designed to display various pieces of information and links that are typically found at the bottom of a web page. The footer is divided into several sections, each containing different types of content.
The code doesn't take any direct inputs, but it uses data that has been prepared elsewhere in the application. This includes information about policy pages, contact details, app store links, and social media icons. These pieces of data are accessed through variables like $policyPages, $contactInfo, $appStores, and $socialIcons.
The output of this code is an HTML structure that forms the footer of the website. It includes the site logo, a short description, download links for mobile apps, navigation menus, contact information, and social media links.
To achieve its purpose, the code uses a combination of HTML structure and Laravel Blade template syntax. It creates a grid layout using Bootstrap classes to organize the content into columns. Within each column, it generates different elements such as links, images, and text content.
The code includes several important logic flows:
1. It loops through $appStores to display multiple app download links. 2. It creates a menu of "Other Pages" with hard-coded links to Home, Blogs, and Contact pages. 3. It loops through $policyPages to create links to various policy documents. 4. It displays contact information retrieved from $contactInfo. 5. It loops through $socialIcons to create a list of social media links.
Throughout the code, there are translations applied to various text elements using the @lang directive, which suggests that the website supports multiple languages.
In summary, this code generates a comprehensive footer for a website, pulling in various pieces of dynamic content and organizing them into a structured layout. It provides users with important links, contact information, and ways to connect with the website's associated mobile apps and social media presence.
